Package ca.team4308.absolutelib.control

Class JoystickHelper

java.lang.Object
ca.team4308.absolutelib.control.JoystickHelper
public class JoystickHelper extends Object
Utility class for processing joystick inputs with various deadzone and scaling algorithms. Provides methods to handle different types of deadzones and input scaling for better control.

    • JoystickHelper

      public JoystickHelper()

  • Method Details

    • SlopedScaledAxialDeadzone

      public static Vector2 SlopedScaledAxialDeadzone(Vector2 stickInput, double deadzone)
      Applies a sloped scaled axial deadzone to the joystick input. The deadzone varies based on the magnitude of the perpendicular axis.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      deadzone - The deadzone value to apply (0.0 to 1.0)
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the processed input values

    • ScaledRadialDeadzone

      public static Vector2 ScaledRadialDeadzone(Vector2 stickInput, double deadzone)
      Applies a scaled radial deadzone to the joystick input. Creates a circular deadzone around the center of the stick.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      deadzone - The deadzone value to apply (0.0 to 1.0)
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the processed input values

    • HybridDeadzone

      public static Vector2 HybridDeadzone(Vector2 stickInput, double deadzone)
      Combines radial and axial deadzones for a hybrid approach. First applies a radial deadzone, then an axial deadzone to the result.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      deadzone - The deadzone value to apply (0.0 to 1.0)
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the processed input values

    • AxialDeadzone

      public static Vector2 AxialDeadzone(Vector2 stickInput, double deadzone)
      Applies a simple axial deadzone independently to each axis. Values below the deadzone are set to zero.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      deadzone - The deadzone value to apply (0.0 to 1.0)
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the processed input values

    • ScaledAxialDeadzone

      public static Vector2 ScaledAxialDeadzone(Vector2 stickInput, double deadzone)
      Applies a scaled axial deadzone to each axis independently. Rescales the output to maintain smooth transitions.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      deadzone - The deadzone value to apply (0.0 to 1.0)
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the processed input values

    • isStickCentered

      public static boolean isStickCentered(Vector2 stickInput, double deadzone)
      Checks if the joystick input is within the deadzone (centered).
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      deadzone - The deadzone value to check against (0.0 to 1.0)
      Returns:
      true if the stick is within the deadzone, false otherwise

    • scaleStick

      public static Vector2 scaleStick(Vector2 stickInput, double scale)
      Applies exponential scaling to the joystick input.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      scale - The exponential scale factor
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the scaled input values

    • alternateScaleStick

      public static Vector2 alternateScaleStick(Vector2 stickInput, double scale)
      Applies alternative exponential scaling that preserves the input direction. Scales the magnitude while maintaining the angle of the input.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      scale - The exponential scale factor
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the scaled input values

    • precisionScaleStick

      public static Vector2 precisionScaleStick(Vector2 stickInput, double scale, double precision)
      Applies precision-weighted exponential scaling to the joystick input. Blends between linear and exponential response based on precision factor.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      scale - The exponential scale factor
      precision - The blend factor between linear (0.0) and exponential (1.0) scaling
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the scaled input values

    • cubicDeadzone

      public static Vector2 cubicDeadzone(Vector2 stickInput, double deadzone, double precision, double scale)
      Applies a cubic function with deadzone and precision scaling. Provides smooth transitions and precise control.
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      deadzone - The deadzone value to apply (0.0 to 1.0)
      precision - The precision factor for control sensitivity
      scale - The exponential scale factor
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the processed input values

    • clampStick

      public static Vector2 clampStick(Vector2 stickInput)
      Clamps the joystick input values to the range [-1, 1].
      Parameters:
      stickInput - The input vector from the joystick
      Returns:
      A new Vector2 with the clamped input values
